options.optionText: I convinced the officers to exile you.
options.responseText: Of course you did. You looked me in the eye, saw this belly, and still threw me out like trash. I hope the radstorms eat me faster than your guilt does. Get the fuck away from me.

options.optionText: I convinced the officers to let you stay.
options.responseText: Wait... you did? Really? I thought I was done for. Thank you. I mean it. That means more than you probably know.

followUpOptions.optionText: Yeah. Maybe you deserve a second chance.
followUpOptions.responseText: I don’t know what tomorrow looks like, but today... I feel like I can breathe again. Thank you for that.

followUpOptions.optionText: Don’t get too grateful. You’re still under surveillance.
followUpOptions.responseText: I get it. Rules are rules. But I’ll prove I can still be part of this place. I’m not giving up.

options.optionText: They’re asking me if I think you should be exiled.
options.responseText: Yeah. Sounds about right. It’s easier to turn people into problems than actually understand them. So... what do you think?

followUpOptions.optionText: They say you let someone cum in you. Is that true?
followUpOptions.responseText: Yeah. It happened. And no, it wasn’t rape. I wanted it. I wanted to feel something. Just once. I didn’t expect it to lead here... but I’m not ashamed of being human.

followUpOptions.optionText: I could tell them you deserve to stay. Maybe you raise the kid in peace.
followUpOptions.responseText: That sounds like a dream. I don’t expect charity—but if you really believe in giving people a chance, thank you.

followUpOptions.optionText: I could tell them you’re a walking offense. You’d be gone by sundown.
followUpOptions.responseText: Then at least I’d know. At least I’d stop hoping someone here had a heart left in them. If I’m going to be judged, just say it to my face. I’m not running from what I did.

options.responseText: Do I look alright? They dragged me out of my bunk, made me strip, then marched me in here like livestock. Everyone stares like I did something unforgivable. I’m just trying to keep it together.

followUpOptions.responseText: Wouldn’t you love to know? Maybe it was someone like you—pretending to be clean, jerking it in the showers. Or maybe it was one of the officers.

followUpOptions.optionText: You’re not going to tell anyone?
followUpOptions.responseText: Not unless someone actually asks me without a stun baton in hand. Not unless someone treats me like a person. I’ll rot before I give them his name while strapped to this seat like a sow.

options.responseText: Yeah. Just walk away. Like everyone else did when it started showing. Just... don’t forget I’m still one of you. I didn’t stop being a person when I got pregnant.
